docs.lead_paragraph: Among 11 proposed amendments to the Florida Constitution, No. 6 would ban state money for abortions, and No. 8 would remove language barring religious institutions from receiving state money.

headline.seo: Floridians Face Initiatives on Abortion and Church and State
headline.main: Voters in Florida Are Set to Weigh In on Two Contentious Ballot Questions
headline.print_headline: Voters in Florida Are Set to Weigh In on Two Contentious Ballot Questions

docs.abstract: Among 11 proposed amendments to the Florida Constitution, one would ban state money for abortions, and another would remove language barring religious institutions from receiving state money; both issues have galvanized supporters and opponents, and could have far-reaching repercussions.
docs.snippet: Among 11 proposed amendments to the Florida Constitution, No. 6 would ban state money for abortions, and No. 8 would remove language barring religious institutions from receiving state money.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an economy where women now make up half the work force, we’re going to have to address the treatment of pregnant employees more systemically.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Alissa Quart contends issue of treatment of pregnant employees demands attention, particularly in an economy in which women make up half the work force; observes that despite many high-profile cases of pregnancy not being hindrance to women's careers, for many it is still detrimental to their job prospects.
docs.snippet: In an economy where women now make up half the work force, we’re going to have to address the treatment of pregnant employees more systemically.

docs.lead_paragraph: Todd Akin, a member of the House who is running for Senate from Missouri, lost the support of many fellow Republicans after he made comments about abortion and “legitimate rape.”

headline.seo: Some in G.O.P. See Little Choice but to Back Todd Akin
headline.main: Some in G.O.P. Choose to Return to Akin’s Corner
headline.print_headline: Some in G.O.P. Choose to Return to Shunned Senate Hopeful’s Corner

docs.abstract: Missouri Republican Rep Todd Akin, who is running for Senate, is regaining some of the support he lost after his controversial comments about rape and abortion.
docs.snippet: Todd Akin, a member of the House who is running for Senate from Missouri, lost the support of many fellow Republicans after he made comments about abortion and “legitimate rape.”

docs.lead_paragraph: A mother-in-law resorts to tricks to make her point, a girlfriend overspends, and a worker struggles with sugary snacks.

headline.seo: Social Q’s – A Sharp but Cowardly Tongue

docs.abstract: Philip Galanes Social Q's offers advice on dealing with passive-aggressive mother-in-laws, overspending girlfriends, unpronounceable first names and nosy questions about getting pregnant.
docs.snippet: A mother-in-law resorts to tricks to make her point, a girlfriend overspends, and a worker struggles with sugary snacks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lois Lowry has written a masterpiece of children’s literature by not pandering to parents.

headline.seo: Lois Lowry, the Children’s Author Who Actually Listens to Children
headline.main: The Children’s Author Who Actually Listens to Children

docs.abstract: Dan Kois Riff essay examines enduring appeal of book The Giver by children's author Lois Lowry; observes that Lowry's books, including Son, latest in so-called Giver Quartet, are firmly rooted in her experience of having lost her son.
docs.snippet: Lois Lowry has written a masterpiece of children’s literature by not pandering to parents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some corporate pork buyers are refusing to buy pork derived from farms that use tiny gestation crates, but farmers argue that the crates are for the good of the sow — and consumers.

headline.seo: Pig Farmers Face Pressure on the Size of the Sty
headline.main: Pig Farmers Face Pressure on the Size of the Sty
headline.print_headline: A Feud Over the Size of the Sty

docs.abstract: Hog farmers are under increasing pressure form corporate pork buyers and animal rights groups to stop using small gestation crates for pregnant sows; producers insist that using the crates helps keep sows safe, while reducing the overall cost of production.
docs.snippet: Some corporate pork buyers are refusing to buy pork derived from farms that use tiny gestation crates, but farmers argue that the crates are for the good of the sow — and consumers.

keywords.value: Humane Society of the United States
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: An unadvertised use for the OraQuick test may become popular and even help slow the AIDS epidemic, experts said.

headline.seo: Another Use for Home H.I.V. Test: Screening Partners
headline.main: Another Use for Rapid Home H.I.V. Test: Screening Sexual Partners
headline.print_headline: Another Use for Rapid Home H.I.V. Test: Screening Sexual Partners

docs.abstract: OraQuick, first rapid home-testing kit for HIV, has gone on sale but some experts and advocates say that another, unadvertised use for test--screening potential sexual partners--may become popular and even help slow the epidemic.
docs.snippet: An unadvertised use for the OraQuick test may become popular and even help slow the AIDS epidemic, experts said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch says that a staff member received repeated threats this week of an attack focused on her pregnancy.

headline.seo: Human Rights Watch Says Its Moscow Researcher Threatened
headline.main: Rights Group Says Its Researcher in Moscow Is Threatened

docs.abstract: Human Rights Watch says Tanya Lokshina, staff member in Moscow, has received repeated threats of an attack focused on her pregnancy; group calls it the latest example of escalating pressure against rights and civic groups in Russia.
docs.snippet: Human Rights Watch says that a staff member received repeated threats this week of an attack focused on her pregnancy.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Do We Ban App Distractions, Too?

docs.abstract: David Pogue says he'll still ask Siri to "read my messages" while his attention is on the road. Yes, of course, any kind of distraction is worse than none. But hearing one sentence read aloud seems to be the least of our automotive distractions, he says.

headline.main: Think Like a Doctor: The Girl in a Coma

docs.abstract: Can you solve the mystery of a 20-year-old young woman who is dropped off at the emergency room unconscious after attending a concert the night before?
docs.snippet: Can you solve the mystery of a 20-year-old young woman who is dropped off at the emergency room unconscious after attending a concert the night before?
